metadata.title: CVE-2022-4269 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel Traffic Control (TC) subsystem. Usinga specific networking configuration (redirecting egress packets to ingressusing TC action "mirred") a local unprivileged user could trigger a CPUsoft lockup (ABBA deadlock) when the transport protocol in use (TCP orSCTP) does a retransmission, resulting in a denial of service condition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4269` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
